column27: Podgorica, Danilovgrad, Bjelopavlići Plain, Kolašin, Mojkovac, Bijelo Polje, Šavnik, Nikšić, Berane
column41: Displaced people = 6146, Infrastructure damage: Bar–Belgrade railway disrupted due to landslides; roads around Mojkovac towards Kolašin and Bijelo Polje closed; traffic connections around Kolašin disrupted causing temporary isolation; severe damage to local roads and bridges reported in Lijeva Rijeka and multiple other locations (no figures); Šavnik concrete block factory completely destroyed; approximately 100 m of the Mojkovac tailings dam destroyed; drinking water in Kolašin supplied by tankers from Podgorica; indirect electricity and communication disruptions reported.

column32: Tailings dam (Mojkovac lead & zinc mine): ≈150 m section damaged
column41: Flooding was associated with river overflow in the Tara River basin and caused damage to critical industrial infrastructure, including the Mojkovac lead and zinc mine tailings facility, where approximately 150 metres of the tailings dam structure were damaged during the floods.

column41: Large-scale forest fires affected central and southern Montenegro between 8–24 August 2021. According to GDACS and GWIS satellite data, approximately 15,516 hectares of forest and shrubland burned. No fatalities or confirmed damage to houses or infrastructure were reported.

column9: Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS)
column41: Separate wildfire episode in northern Montenegro during August 2021. GWIS satellite observations indicate approximately 5,560 hectares of forested and mountainous land burned. Impacts were largely limited to natural land cover, with no reported casualties or structural damage.
